_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FIELD SOLUTIONS LLC  IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS THAT PRIMARILY  SELLS FERTILIZER TO AREA CROP PRODUCERS FOR CROP ENHANCEMENT.

THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA PLANT CONSIST OF ONE 12,000 AND TWO 11,000 GALLON TANK WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 159,000 POUNDS. IN ADDITION THERE ARE 32-1000 GALLON NURSE TANKS THAT CONTAIN 4400 POUNDS EACH (TOTAL 140,800) , THAT MAKES TOTAL POSSIBLE STORAGE OF 299,800 POUNDS AT THIS LOCATION AT ANY ONE TIME.  THE PLANT IS DESIGNED AND MAINTAINED WITH STRICT ADHERANCE TO ALL LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR FACILITIES EACH YEAR AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL THEIR REQUEST FOR IMPROVEMENT.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD RELEASE A TOTAL OF 53,000 POUNDS WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF .74  MILES AND HAS THE POTENTIAL TO AFFECT APPROXIMATELY 1525 AREA RESIDENTS.

THE EMPLOYEES WHO WORK IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ARE TRAINED ON A REGULAR BASIS IN THE SAFETY INFORMATION, HAZARDS, OPERATING PROCEDURES AND THE MAINTENANCE PRACTICES OF A TYPICAL AMMONIA PLANT.  THEY ALWAYS USE GOGGLES AND THE APPROPRIATE GLOVES WHILE FILLING NURSE TANKS.  CLEAN SAFEY WATER IS ALWAYS PRESENT DURING THE AMMONIA OPERATION.

THIS COMPANY, BECAUSE OF ITS TRAINING PROGRAM CAN BOAST OF NO INJURY ACCIDENTS AND OR ANY PROPERTY DAMAGE WITHIN THE LAST FIVE YEARS.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED AND DISCUSSED WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND THEY'VE AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENTAL TOXIC RELEASE OR ANY OTHER EMERGENCY SITUATION WHICH MAY EXIST.  TOURS ARE GIVEN TO LOCAL FIREMAN TO MAKE THEM AWARE OF THE DANGERS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.
